name: The Citadel | 2 Parking | Pool & BBQ | Office & AC
description:
Come and enjoy an unforgettable stay in the heart of the Saint-Roch district in Quebec City. These two modern and luxurious condos will charm you as much by their common spaces as by their interior design.


✧️ 2 parking space provided
✧️ Roof terrace with pool & outdoor fireplace
✧️ BBQ and dining area
✧️ Fitness room
✧️ Bright and pleasant apartment
✧️ Fast wifi and work space
✧️ Just a 15 minute walk to Old Quebec
neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is a trendy neighborhood with many small restaurants, cafes and lively bars. It is also home to boutiques selling clothing, home goods and toys along St. Joseph Street. Concert halls, theaters and contemporary art galleries dot the area. The Jean-Paul-L'Allier Garden features an artificial waterfall, and the huge Saint-Roch Church is nearby.


↣ Chute de Montmorency only 13 minutes away
↣ Wendake reserve and its forest hikes only 20 minutes away
↣ Old Quebec and its cobblestone streets at 15 minutes by foot or 5 minutes by car
↣ The famous Christmas Boutique of Quebec City at only 15 minutes walking distance
↣ The Citadel of Quebec City 6 minutes away by car

name: Cheerful and spacious treetop home away from home
description:
A colourful, plant-filled and Mexican-inspired oasis in the Saint-Sauveur neighbourhood of Quebec City.

A spacious and charming 1900's era apartment with two bedrooms, dedicated work space, living and dining area, fully functional kitchen and in-unit laundry.

My home becomes your home for your stay. Welcome!

CITQ registration: 311657
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood of Saint Sauveur is a quiet and primarily residential neighbourhood. It is vibrant, lively and safe, filled with young professionals and families young and old. As a historically working-class neighbourhood of the city, you'll be charmed by the architecture and the small, walkable streets.

There are a number of excellent restaurants and cafes within 10-15 minute walk from the apartment.

A large well-supplied grocery store is about 5 minutes by foot.

A pharmacy around the corner is a great place to purchase bus tickets or post something in the mail.
host_about:
For years I've loved using Airbnb when I travel.  I love the uniqueness of the places it enables me to visit, and I love staying in the non-touristy areas of cities to get a sense of what it's like to actually live in the places I visit.  Now, I am so happy to be hosting other travelers in my home!  

I work remotely as the Quality Assurance Lead for a software company, while in the past I worked as a housekeeper in hotels and also ran my own eco-friendly house cleaning business.
  
When I'm not working, I'm listening to music and podcasts, running, reading, saving money, spending time outside, and growing things.

"Only when the head and the heart work in harmony, can we achieve our true potential." - Jane Goodall

description:
This new modern condo is located in an ideal location close to all attractions, restaurants, shops and nightlife. The City Life is a bright corner unit located on the 3 th floor with a balcony. You will be charmed with its beautiful and tasteful decor.
CITQ licence number : 297611
neighborhood_overview:
When searching for a condo as an investment, we were looking for the perfect spot with a minimum of maintenance to do. Something close to the city with a specific local vibe. So when we heard about the Kameleon project, we knew right away that this would be the perfect place to welcome guests from all over the world! Close enough to the Old City but in a district that have all the best restaurants to discover. Foodies you will not be disappointed! You can also take a culinary tour that occurs in the same street as The City Life . You can easily walk to rue St-Joseph and discover all this vibrant street has to offer. We as locals, often go to theese very close by restaurants: Kraken cru ( seafood) Batutto (voted top 10 best new Canadian restaurant) l’Affaire est Ketshup, la Champagnerie ( large champagne selection)
and also le Clocher Penché ( French Bistrot ) And if you want to enjoy a delicious poutine Top o Frites is just beside!
host_about: J’adore voyager! En tant qu’invité ce que j’aime est de m’imprégner de la culture locale de l’endroit. Donc en tant qu’hôte nous souhaitons faire vivre la même expérience à nos invités. C’est pourquoi nos propriétés sont choisies méticuleusement selon la localisation, la qualité de l’hébergement et l’expérience globale.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | By  Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA404
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

neighborhood_overview:
The Montcalm district in Quebec City is a highly sought-after neighborhood known for its charm, historic ambiance, and vibrant atmosphere. Situated just outside the walls of Old Quebec, Montcalm offers a perfect blend of convenience and tranquility, making it an excellent choice for a vacation rental property. Here's how you might describe the Montcalm district to potential renters:

Welcome to the Montcalm District - Your Gateway to Quebec City's Elegance and Culture

Nestled in the heart of Quebec City, the Montcalm district is a refined and picturesque neighborhood that embodies the city's rich history and contemporary flair. This sought-after location seamlessly combines the allure of old-world charm with the convenience of modern amenities, creating a delightful atmosphere for your vacation getaway.

Historic Elegance and Architectural Beauty:
Montcalm is renowned for its stunning architecture, with tree-lined streets showcasing elegant Victorian

name: SR102 - Les Lofts St-Roch - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Make full use of this spacious apartment capable of accommodating up to 5 people. Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and your own washer & dryer to enhance your experience!
Opened in 2019 and freshly renovated, Les Lofts St-Roch are situated on the most vibrant street in Québec City at the moment. You’ll find dozens of restaurants, cafés, shops and local shops. It is the place to go for a drink and a good meal!
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

description:
Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun.
Perfect for a family or friends gathering, with its 3 closed bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, big kitchen and fire place in the living room.

host_about:
We are a young family who runs a hotel down town Quebec City! This is a new listing but we are more than use to work with travellers from all around the world!
We have been host on Airbnb in the past and still host many guests in our hotel every day.

name: Heritage Charm w/ Parking & Terrace in Old QC
description: Sit by a roaring fire in the city's coolest historical district, or unwind on the rooftop terrace with a view of the hills. Ideal for romance or remote work, our home features two offices, 123-year-old wooden beams, a modern kitchen, cozy seating, hammock balcony, a Frida Kahlo-inspired bathroom, and a TV room we call "the Nest." Indulge in the large shower and bathtub of the lavish bathroom. Blissful relaxation awaits in every corner! 7 min walk to our free parking.
neighborhood_overview: Discover the enchanting Saint-Jean Baptiste Neighborhood in the heart of Quebec City! This vibrant district seamlessly blends old-world charm with a trendy atmosphere. Stroll through the streets, admire 19th-century architecture, and explore quaint boutiques. Indulge in French-Canadian cuisine and savor coffee in cozy cafes. Immerse yourself in history with landmarks like Église Saint-Jean-Baptiste. Relax in the local parks, or stroll down the best areas in town - all within 5 minutes walk. La Rue Cartier in Montcalm, St-Joseph in St-Roch, and la Rue Saint-Jean are all just a few steps out the door and all have wonderful things to discover. Experience the lively nightlife scene with bars and live music venues. Conveniently located, explore Quebec City's historic Old Town and the stunning Plains of Abraham. Embrace the warm hospitality of locals as they preserve their heritage. Saint-Jean Baptiste promises a magical and unforgettable getaway for culture enthusiasts and foodies alike.
host_about:
Hi! 

My name is Matthew. My life revolves around good friends, a great book, hiking to the edges of the earth and travelling as much as possible! Looking forward to connecting with you.

name: * Maison patrimoniale William 1er *
description:
Large ancestral house from 1825 completely renovated to the taste of the day. Entire AIR-CONDITIONED. JACUZZI AVAILABLE ALL SEASONS.
Alternating between modern and historical character, this house will please you. Fully equipped and functional everything is there for a memorable stay. The historic area of Old Beauport is a charm and offers you proximity to all services . Only 10 minutes away from Downtown Quebec City.
neighborhood_overview: The Old Beauport neighbourhood corresponds to Beauport's city centre, which is also its historic centre. It is bounded to the west by the Beauport River, to the south by the St. Lawrence River, to the north by the Félix-Leclerc Highway and to the east by Francheville Street. Girardin House is a farm house located at 600 Royal Avenue in the Beauport borough of Quebec City. It was built on an unknown date between 1784 and 1819, making it one of the oldest houses on the chemin du Roy. It was designated a heritage building in 1977 and designated a national historic site of Canada in 1982. Vieux-Bourg1, provisionally known as Quartier 5-4 on Quebec City official documents, is one of 35 neighbourhoods in Quebec City, and one of five in the Beauport borough.
host_about: Je suis une infirmière passionnée, qui adore voyager et accueillir des gens de partout dans le monde. Hôtes Airbnb depuis plusieurs années et ayant un grand souci de la satisfaction des voyageurs, je vous assure des séjours inoubliables.

description: Welcome to a warm and bright home ready to accommodate 7 people. Located in a quiet, family-friendly neighborhood in the Limoilou district, the house offers the quietness of the suburbs while being close to the city center and its tourist attractions. You will have your own parking to facilitate your movements. Finally, you will be only a few steps away from the famous Videotron Amphitheater. Who is feeling lucky ?
neighborhood_overview:
Limoilou is a neighborhood in full excitement. Neighbors invite each other, families fraternize, friends come alive. We picnic in the park and we pique a jasette. We race along the river and run along 3rd Avenue. With its bistros, cafes, delicatessens, bakeries and charcuteries, the bubbling avenue, just steps from your loft, is a party for gourmands. On summer evenings, the terraces swarm with people, each greeting his neighbor in a joyful hubbub typical of the spirit of the neighborhood. Pubs and microbreweries can stretch the evening until late at night.

You can also spend the calories along the beautiful Saint-Charles River in the enchanting setting of the bike path.

In this warm, family-friendly neighborhood, feel safe at all times.

Beautiful and large apartment RENOVATED and comfortable for up to 6 people including 2 closed bedrooms, a large living room and a fully equipped and functional kitchen, a very large terrace and a work area. The Saint-Roch neighbourhood is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City. A constantly buzzing neighborhood combining media technology and cultural life with its trendy Rue Saint-Joseph (libraries, theatres, theatre, shops and very friendly restaurants and bars), all to make your stay as pleasant as possible.
The Saint-Roch district is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Quebec. A neighborhood in constant excitement or marry media technologies and cultural life with its trendy St. Joseph Street (Libraries, theaters, auditorium, shops and restaurants and bars very friendly,), everything to make your stay more pleasant.
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple mixte et nous vivons à Québec. Nous aimons la vie sous toutes ses formes : bien manger, boire, dormir, flâner, écouter de la musique et beaucoup bricoler et partager. 
Pour nous le contact est primordial, il nous nourrit. Rencontrer du monde de partout et leur offrir notre univers est ce que nous avons de plus précieux et c'est pourquoi nous sommes ici. 

We are a mixed couple and we live in Quebec City. We love life in all its forms: eating well, drinking, sleeping, strolling, listening to music, tinkering and sharing.
For us the contact is primordial, it nourishes us. To meet people from all over the world and to offer them our universe is what we have most precious and that is why we are on this platform.

name: Old Quebec Historic heritage home of 2700 sq ft
description: Historic heritage residence of 2700 square feet in the Old-Port of Quebec City. Built in 1827 and was once owned by a prime minister of Quebec, the property has retained most of its original features with exposed beams on the ceiling and stone walls. With a fully-equipped kitchen, newly furnished, free WI-FI, central A/C, on-site parking spaces and more. The condo is one of the very few units that are located at a walking-distance from all the most popular attractions of the Old Quebec City.

name: Le Jules
description:
Welcome to Jules, a brand new condo, located in the beautiful district of St-Roch, on the 6th floor of an entirely new building! Close to Old Quebec and the Plains of Abraham, the Jules offers a fully equipped condo with air conditioning and two bedrooms. You will also have access to a rooftop terrace, equipped with a BBQ and pool.
CITQ #: 310723
neighborhood_overview: A 15-minute walk from Old Quebec, Saint-Roch is a vibrant neighborhood. There are a beautiful variety of shops, restaurants and trendy bars. Thanks to its modern style, refreshing green spaces and proximity to tourist attractions, the Saint-Roch neighborhood is the perfect place to enjoy the unique charm of Quebec City!
host_about:
Bonjour à vous!

Nous sommes Émilie, Dominic, Lauriane et Philippe et nous sommes les North Travelers. Nous sommes deux couples d'amis qui, après avoir fait un voyage en Europe, sommes tombés en amour avec les logements de type Airbnb! Nous avons construit de nombreux souvenirs et avons adoré le fait de pouvoir avoir le confort d'une maison au prix d'une chambre d'hôtel! Voulant partager cette expérience au Québec, nous nous sommes lancés dans l'aventure de devenir des hôtes Airbnb! Il nous fera plaisir de vous accueillir dans ce logement qui, nous l'espérons, vous fera sentir comme à la maison! Au plaisir et bon séjour! :)

name: Luxurious and warm condo, in the heart of Quebec
description:
Air-conditioned, luxurious, bright, comfortable, warm and clean condo, located in the heart of downtown, behind St. Joseph Street where neighborhood shops and restaurants abound. The location allows you to discover the city on foot, in complete safety.

Our space includes a living room, large dining room with windows, entertainment room (sofa bed) and two bedrooms.

NO PARTIES ALLOWED. NO PETS ALLOWED. NO SMOKING. Risk of eviction without refund.
neighborhood_overview:
The St-Roch district is one of the most dynamic in Quebec City. Good restaurants, local shops and delicatessens are all nearby and provide travelers with a lively city life experience. You can get to all the must-sees in less than 20 minutes on foot, or by bus (RTC) and by car very quickly.

Old Quebec (fortifications and St-Jean street), museums, parks (Victoria Park and St-Charles river), Champlain promenade, Old Port as well as the Petit-Champlain district are all accessible at less than 5 km.

The big events of the city are also all located a few minutes walk away and you will have access to the trendiest places to enjoy the nightlife, which are all on Rue St-Joseph.
host_about: Mélanie Rhéaume. Maman d’un garçon de 11 ans, j’adore la ville et mon quartier. Je suis sportive... rien de mieux que le Vieux-Quebec et le bord de la rivière Saint-Charles pour la course à pied !

name: QBEDS Hostel-Amazing location! 11 Beds Female Dorm
description:
THE BEST HOSTEL IN TOWN!

QBEDS Hostel is ideally located on Grande-Allée street, which is undoubtedly the most popular street in Quebec city! You can find various bars, cafes and restaurants on Grande-Allee street, in the heart of downtown Quebec city. Its unique funky design and vibe will definitely make you feel like home! We have everything you have always dreamt of; a cinema room, an indoor forest with lots of hammocks, a fully equipped bar and much more!
neighborhood_overview: Grande-Allée Street is located in the heart of Old Quebec, which is where most events and festivals happen all year long. Located at a walking distance from most major attractions like the Parliament, the Château Frontenac and the Plains of Abraham, QBEDS Hostel is right in the middle of all the action! You will also find various bars, cafes and restaurants all along Grande-Allee street and the surrounding streets. This street is also part of the historic town, since it was used in the 19th century as a residential street for the rich upper-class in Quebec City. You can admire the architecture of QBEDS Hostel, which was built in 1900 by William A. Marsh, a rich salesman. You'll notice the historic aspects of our building both inside and outside the building, who was well preserved throughout the years.

name: SP109 - Lofts St-Pierre - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description: Les Lofts Saint-Pierre is located in a building that previously belonged to the Bank of Montreal and was their first branch in North America. Constructed in 1927, it constitutes an important architectural element of the Saint-Pierre street, that was the hotbed of Quebec’s financial activity. At the intersection of the St-Pierre and St-Jacques streets, neighbouring the Musée de la Civilisation (Museum of Civilization). Only a few meters from the cruise terminal and the St-Lawrence river.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

host_about:
Chers futurs guests,

J’adore voyager et je suis donc souvent absent. À mes yeux la meilleure façon de découvrir une ville est en y vivant comme quelqu’un de local et cela passe, bien entendu, par le logement. C’est dans cette optique que lors de mes voyages je laisse mon logement à disposition des voyageurs du monde entier, alors : pourquoi pas vous ?  :)

Pas d’inquiétude, même si je ne suis pas présent lors de vos réservations, Exode Bnb, à laquelle j’ai confié la gestion de mon logement, saura rendre votre séjour aussi agréable que possible !

A très vite,

David.

Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Exode Bnb, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

David.

name: Comfy house in Quebec City's trendy neighbourhood
description: Our house is a brand new construction that we designed ourselves. It's a very cosy place with a minimalist feel and tones of natural light! The house is surrounded by mature maple trees and we have a big backyard with a lovely terrace, perfect for happy hours. Our neighbourhood is called Limoilou. It is just outside the "haute ville" (city center/old town), but still is in the city :) It is very quiet and everything is walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Limoilou, a vibrant neighborhood nestled in the heart of Quebec City! Located just north of the city's historic district, Limoilou offers a unique blend of history, culture, and modern urban living.

As you stroll through the charming streets of Limoilou, you'll be captivated by its rich architectural heritage. The area boasts a mix of beautifully preserved historic buildings alongside contemporary designs (like our house!), creating an intriguing juxtaposition of old and new.

Limoilou is known for its lively atmosphere, with a bustling community that thrives on creativity and diversity. The neighborhood is home to a thriving arts scene, with numerous street festivals. You'll find a vibrant street art scene, where colorful murals adorn the buildings, adding a touch of creativity to the urban landscape.

Food lovers will be delighted by the culinary offerings in Limoilou. The neighborhood is brimming with cozy cafes (we love the KOGI CAFÉ), tren
host_about:
Senior Graphic Designer based in Québec City, QC, Canada. I love music, design, photography, typography, architecture, food & cold brew coffee.

SOCIAL MEDIA: Twitter for news, Facebook for family and friends, LinkedIn for networking, Spotify for music

MUST-HAVE ITEMS FOR VANCOUVER: Camera, appetite for sushi

FAVORITE BRAND: Coca Cola

I AM MY BEST SELF: In the morning

I CRAVE: Sweets

I COLLECT: T-shirts

COFFEE OR TEA? Coffee (cold brew in the summer, Americano otherwise), with milk only

FAVORITE WEBSITE: Under Consideration and its blog, Quipsologies

I AM STILL HOPING FOR: Back To The Future 4 and The Goonies 2

INTERESTING FACT: I believe chocolate and mint should never go together. Period.

name: 203 - Les Lofts St-Joseph - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in a freshly renovated 1918 building with tall pilasters, a monumental cornice, and arched windows, this signature Loft is situated in a cultural, commercial and trendy district.
Make full use of this spacious 2nd floor 2-bedroom apartment capable of accommodating up to 6 people. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio.
Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and your own washer & dryer to enhance your experience!
An elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

name: Villa Montcalm: Prestige & Confort au Vieux-Québec
description:
Immerse yourself in the luxury of Villa Montcalm and create unforgettable memories in the heart of Quebec City. This property has everything to offer an upscale, comfortable and elegant experience, while being close to everything that renowned Old Quebec has to offer.

Book your stay now and enter a world where historical grandeur meets modern elegance.

CITQ #: 313625
neighborhood_overview:
Stay at the gates of Old Quebec, an iconic neighborhood steeped in history in the heart of the city.

Stroll through its cobblestone streets, lined with picturesque buildings with colorful facades. Visit the famous Plains of Abraham, witnessing historical battles, and explore the majestic Château Frontenac that dominates the urban landscape. Art lovers will enjoy local art galleries, while food lovers can enjoy the refined cuisine of renowned restaurants.

With picturesque shops, lively street shows, and stunning views of the St. Lawrence River, Old Quebec offers an unforgettable experience, steeped in culture and timeless charm.

Beyond the tourist attractions offered by nearby Old Quebec, a wealth of cultural experiences — from bookstores and theater to museums, cinema and art galleries — is a short walk from the Villa. Epicureans will be delighted by the proximity of a selection of renowned restaurants, all within walking distance.

name: G101 - Lofts de la Gare - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in the hundred-year-old Gare du Palais, Les Lofts de la Gare offers you a one-of-a-kind experience in Lower Québec City. Built in 1915 and designated as a heritage railway station in 1992, la Gare du Palais is a true château-style architectural gem that inevitably recalls the imposing Château Frontenac and Manège Militaire (Armoury).
Right next to the Old Port of Québec, it allows you to explore its adorable streets and visit its countless traditional shops and restaurants
neighborhood_overview:
Les Lofts de la Gare are very centrally located in Old Québec, which allows you to explore then retreat in your cosy and quiet apartment. It is very easy to get a taxi with a station just outside the door. It is the perfect stay if you are leaving early or arriving late on the train or bus as the entrance to your apartment is in the station.
From there, you can walk within 10 minutes to Petit Champlain and Place Royale, where the European explorers first settled in 1608.
Reach the Chateau Frontenac within 20 minutes walk and explore the surrounding streets filled with history.
Shop and dine on rue St-Joseph, just a few minutes away. Dozens of amazing restaurants are within walking distance.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located between the dynamic Rue St-Joseph (Basse-Ville) and the historic Rue St-Jean (Haute-Ville). You will appreciate the proximity to all services (pharmacy, grocery store, restaurants, cafes, shops, public transport, etc.).

Nouvo Saint-Roch is a trendy neighborhood with many small restaurants, cafes and lively bars. It also houses shops selling clothes, household items, and toys along St. Joseph. Concert rooms, theaters, and contemporary art galleries dot the entire neighborhood. The Jean-Paul-L'Allier garden is decorated with an artificial waterfall and the huge Saint-Roch church is nearby. The city's professional baseball team plays at CANAC Stadium.

Old Quebec is the neighboring neighborhood (1.5 km east on Rue Saint-Vallier Est and you will be there). Old Quebec is large and it may take 30 minutes to cross it. You will find it convenient to have Boulevard Charest nearby if you use the public transport.

name: 103 - Lofts St-Joseph - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Located in a freshly renovated 1918 building with tall pilasters, a monumental cornice, and arched windows, this signature Loft is situated in a cultural, commercial and trendy district.
Make full use of this spacious 1st floor 2-bedroom Loft capable of accommodating up to 6 people. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio.
Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and your own washer & dryer to enhance your experience!
An elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.

name: T302 - Lofts du Trésor - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description:
Experience Old Québec City in a Loft that highlights the history of a freshly renovated 1907 building. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop terrace with the best view in Québec City overlooking the Château Frontenac and Saint-Lawrence River.

Elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
In front of the Basilica-cathedral Notre-Dame de Québec, a couple of doors from the famous Château Frontenac, and located directly in front of the numerous artists showcasing their art outside, Les Lofts du Trésor will make you live an authentic and unforgettable Québécois experience.
You will find within a few minutes walk dozens of restaurants, cafés and shops. You truly are in the heart of Old Québec and will feel the french canadian hospitality at its best!
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

neighborhood_overview:
With its steep-sloped streets, colourful houses piled one on top of the other, and its fun-loving and welcoming character, Saint-Jean-Baptiste is the festive neighbourhood par excellence!
Sandwiched between Old Québec and Montcalm, rue Saint-Jean, the main shopping street, runs through the entire neighbourhood. Over barely 1 km, you can find everything you need to please everyone, and then some! Every weekend from mid-May to the end of summer, a portion of rue Saint-Jean converts into a pedestrian-only street.

Foodies will go crazy for the little bistros that feature local cuisine, as well as all the food-related shops: fine bakeries, grocery stores, chocolate stores, health-food counters, cafés, gelateria… Open since 1871, the J.A. Moisan grocery store prides itself on being the oldest grocery store in North America!

The culinary adventure continues with a bit of bar and pub-hopping, where the flowing taps of microbrewery beers from Québec City and all ove

The entire area has recently been transformed by a renovation project that has revived old factories and other buildings. You will find many important shopping streets nearby, including Saint-Joseph Street, Saint-Vallier Street East and West and Cartier Avenue in Haute-Ville. So staying here is ideal if you want to have a shopping therapy. These places are also nice places to meet because they are full of good restaurants and cafes

The apartments are also:

10 minutes from the old harbor,

neighborhood_overview:
Streets lined with majestic trees, narrow alleys where children gather to play, old brick buildings with their spiral staircase ... Welcome to Limoilou!

Hghly prized by young families and entrepreneurs, this warm and original district is currently experiencing a great effervescence.

#Limoilove
#Effervescence
#Goodvibe

With its streets and perpendicular avenues, the organization of the district is modeled on New York. By "rising" the 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we come across a host of small businesses that make you want to stop: delicatessens, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea room, glacier…

The gastronomic scene of Limoilou is in full boiling. There are many great chefs and restaurants emerging in this sweet neighborhood. On summer evenings, the terraces swarm with people, each greeting his neighbor in a joyful hubbub typical of the spirit of the neighborhood.

description:
Huge luxurious condo of 2000 square feet on 2 levels that can accommodate 8 people. Condo completely renovated and located in a historic building. Designed for families but ideal for everyone. 3 bedrooms. Free outdoor parking included. Building located in Old Québec close to all restaurants and tourist attractions. Air-conditioned . Washer-dryer in the house. Complete baby gear. Beautiful in every way!
CITQ permit number: 299665
neighborhood_overview: How to talk about this great place in just a few words? I would say that the best way to enjoy all the attractions that surround the condo is simply to stroll where your heart tells you!  Whether you're heading up to St-Jean Street and its many restaurants, cafes, bars and shops, or wandering down St-Paul Street to reach Petit-Champlain, every step will be rewarded with great discoveries! The Old Port Market with its local products is just across the street too. In summer, you can access the Bassin st-Louise with its many boats or indulge in the delicious Le Charbon steakhouse located at Gare Du Palais.  You can also easily walk to the famous Château Frontenac and its Dufferin Terrace, Rue du Trésor and Rue St-Louis with all the fine dining restaurants.
host_about: J’adore voyager! En tant qu’invité ce que j’aime est de m’imprégner de la culture locale de l’endroit. Donc en tant qu’hôte nous souhaitons faire vivre la même expérience à nos invités. C’est pourquoi nos propriétés sont choisies méticuleusement selon la localisation, la qualité de l’hébergement et l’expérience globale.

name: Maison familiale haute-ville Québec
description: Lovely house located in a quiet residential area in the heart of beautiful Quebec City! Light, greenery, large bay windows, garden and terrace: our house is perfect for those who want to enjoy the charms of the Old Capital as a family. Public transport and bike station at the end of the street. Close to everything: grocery store, small friendly commercial streets, parks, river.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located very close to the beautiful Parc-du-Bois-de-Coulonge. Flowers, fountain, picnic, children's game modules: a beautiful place! In winter, the park has a magical side and a great view of the St. Lawrence River. You can also walk to a grocery store, a fish shop with fresh seafood and a homemade bakery. On Maguire Street you will find a wood-fired bagel factory, a dairy bar and several trendy restaurants and shops offering refined products. Shopping malls are also nearby, as are the famous Plains of Abraham and all of Old Quebec. In fact, the house is located in the middle of the upper city, so you're never far from anything! :-)

name: QBEDS Hostel - Amazing location! 6 Beds Mixed Dorm
description:
THE BEST HOSTEL IN TOWN!

QBEDS Hostel is ideally located on Grande-Allée street, which is undoubtedly the most popular street in Quebec city! You can find various bars, cafes and restaurants on Grande-Allee street, in the heart of downtown Quebec city. Its unique funky design and vibe will definitely make you feel like home! We have everything you have always dreamt of; a cinema room, an indoor forest with lots of hammocks, a fully equipped bar and much more!
neighborhood_overview: Grande-Allée Street is located in the heart of Old Quebec, which is where most events and festivals happen all year long. Located at a walking distance from most major attractions like the Parliament, the Château Frontenac and the Plains of Abraham, QBEDS Hostel is right in the middle of all the action! You will also find various bars, cafes and restaurants all along Grande-Allee street and the surrounding streets. This street is also part of the historic town, since it was used in the 19th century as a residential street for the rich upper-class in Quebec City. You can admire the architecture of QBEDS Hostel, which was built in 1900 by William A. Marsh, a rich salesman. You'll notice the historic aspects of our building both inside and outside the building, who was well preserved throughout the years.

neighborhood_overview:
Beauport is one of the historic and residential neighborhoods in Quebec City, Canada. Located northeast of downtown, it offers a mix of history, quaint charm, and community. Here's a description of Beauport neighborhood:

1. History: Beauport is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Quebec City, with a history that dates back to the 17th century. It was originally a place of French colonization and was centered around agriculture and fishing. Many historic buildings, including stone houses from the colonial days, testify to this rich history.

2. Architecture: The Beauport neighborhood is characterized by its traditional architecture, including French colonial-style stone houses. Tree-lined streets and narrow alleys contribute to the picturesque atmosphere of the neighborhood.

3. Parks and green spaces: Beauport provides easy access to nature and green spaces. Chute-Montmorency Park, with its beautiful waterfalls, is nearby, offering hiking trails, picnic ar

description:
Experience the effervescence of Nouvo-St-Roch at Lofts St-Jo. Restaurants, shops and boutiques can be found at the doorstep of our warm lofts, and within walking distance of all the attractions of Old Quebec.

This cozy apartment is perfect for those looking for comfort and space. Indeed, the unit offers two bathrooms, two living areas and two bedrooms on two floors. You will also appreciate the fully equipped kitchen!
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travels with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home. Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

name: Sleeps 10 | Pet Friendly | near Old Quebec
description:
Perfect for a group or family looking for a comfortable place while exploring Quebec City. This property has two interconnecting apartments, it’s Pet Friendly, with 4 bedrooms, an office workspace, fully equipped kitchen and a BBQ and a Fireplace.

Located only a 15 min walk from the lower part of beautiful Old Quebec and a 2 min walk the famous 3rd Avenue in Limoilou.
neighborhood_overview:
Streets lined with majestic trees, narrow alleys where kids get together to play, old brick buildings with their winding staircases...A favourite among young families and entrepreneurs, this welcoming and original neighbourhood is really coming into its own at the moment. It even has its own slogan: #Limoilove

This is the old part of Limoilou which is getting more and more popular around locals in Quebec City. It's unique because it has some of the most trendiest restaurants in town, lots of them on the now famous 3rd avenue. Few minutes walk away, you can find
- Best pastry
- Many small coffee shop
- Amazing restaurant such as Le Cendrillon, la Planque, Miyagi Bistro thaï & Sushi, Le Salsa, Soupe et Cie
- Pharmacy, grocery store, convenience store

It is more of a locals place than tourist one which makes you see the real side of Quebec City.

Moreover, you are still only 5-10 minutes by car and 15-25 minutes by walk from Old Quebec

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

name: Le Patrimonial
description: Welcome to Le Patrimonial, an apartment located on the road to the new France, in a historic district of Quebec City. Located a stone's throw from Montmorency Falls and Île d 'Orléans, as well as a 10-minute drive from downtown Quebec City, Patrimonial offers a fully equipped apartment. Its large windows with ancestral style and private balcony will make your stay bright and peaceful. This accommodation is therefore an excellent starting point for visiting Quebec City and the surrounding area.
neighborhood_overview:
Beauport is one of the historic and residential neighborhoods in Quebec City, Canada. Located northeast of downtown, it offers a mix of history, quaint charm, and community. Here's a description of Beauport neighborhood:

1. History: Beauport is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Quebec City, with a history that dates back to the 17th century. It was originally a place of French colonization and was centered around agriculture and fishing. Many historic buildings, including stone houses from the colonial days, testify to this rich history.

2. Architecture: The Beauport neighborhood is characterized by its traditional architecture, including French colonial-style stone houses. Tree-lined streets and narrow alleys contribute to the picturesque atmosphere of the neighborhood.

3. Parks and green spaces: Beauport provides easy access to nature and green spaces. Chute-Montmorency Park, with its beautiful waterfalls, is nearby, offering hiking trails, picnic ar
host_about:
Bonjour à vous!

Nous sommes Émilie et Dominic un jeune coupe de voyageurs qui est tombé en amour avec le concept des logement de type Airbnb! Nous avons construit de nombreux souvenirs et avons adoré le fait de pouvoir avoir le confort d'une maison au prix d'une chambre d'hôtel! description:
Come and enjoy an unforgettable stay in the heart of the Saint-Roch district in Quebec City. These two modern and luxurious condos will charm you as much by their common spaces as by their interior design.


✧️ 2 parking space provided
✧️ Roof terrace with pool & outdoor fireplace
✧️ BBQ and dining area

neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is a trendy neighborhood with many small restaurants, cafes and lively bars. It is also home to boutiques selling clothing, home goods and toys along St. Joseph Street. Concert halls, theaters and contemporary art galleries dot the area. The Jean-Paul-L'Allier Garden features an artificial waterfall, and the huge Saint-Roch Church is nearby.


↣ Chute de Montmorency only 13 minutes away
↣ Wendake reserve and its forest hikes only 20 minutes away
↣ Old Quebec and its cobblestone streets at 15 minutes by foot or 5 minutes by car
↣ The famous Christmas Boutique of Quebec City at only 15 minutes walking distance
↣ The Citadel of Quebec City 6 minutes away by car

neighborhood_overview:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD LIMOILOU

With its streets and avenues perpendicular, the organization of the neighborhood is modeled on New York. By « going up » 3rd Avenue, between 2nd and 16th Streets, you will come across a host of small shops that make you want to stop : delicatessen, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea room, glacier... In summer, part of 3rd Avenue is exclusively pedestrian on weekends in the afternoon.

name: V101 - Lofts St-Vallier - Par Les Lofts Vieux-QC
description: The neoclassical Québécois house in which are located Les Lofts St-Vallier was constructed after the 1845 fire, and still boasts its original windows and cut stones. Located between Saint-Jean-Baptiste and Saint-Roch, Les Lofts St-Vallier offers you a colourful experience near Québec City’s most popular tourist attractions. Art galleries, restaurants, and local shops will bring out the epicurean artist in you. Well situated in a peaceful area, you will stay in a patrimonial building.
neighborhood_overview:
What was the most important commercial street in Québec City until the 1960s? Rue Saint-Joseph Est! The main now reclaims its title thanks to young creative entrepreneurs. To check out trendy shops, eat in the most talked-about restaurants, knock back a few in a pub or watch the latest hit show, Saint-Roch is where you go!
The area is particularly appreciated by foodies: the city's best restaurants rub shoulders with little neighbourhood joints where you get great value for your money, while microbreweries are really taking off and brewing refreshingly original beers. Don't forget to visit a gourmet grocer to take back a piece of the local products home with you!
In summer, young professionals from the web and video game industries blend in with the student crowd looking for a place to eat outside in Jardin Jean-Paul-L’Allier, a real oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.
In winter, Saint-Roch is illuminated by a 15-metre Christmas tree; simply magical!
All yea
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

name: 881 L'Appartement Familial      CITQ 304543
description:
Discover the 881, the perfect apartment for families and groups of friends looking for a memorable getaway. Nestled in a lively neighborhood where everything is at your fingertips, you can explore Old Quebec easily, whether on foot, by bus or by car.
Come and enjoy a unique experience in this apartment that combines comfort and conviviality!
host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

name: 3 Bds/9 beds * Large Pkng * 2 Levels * Near stores
description: ❤ Charm yourself by staying in this two levels luminous 3 bedrooms unit. Podium bath + Ind shower. 2 toilets. Large entry / storage room for your equipment. Roomy kitchen. neighborhood_overview: Between the city and the mountains. This residence offers you the best of both worlds. Perfectly situated in the center of Village Vacances Valcartier (including the new interior water attraction: Bora Parc), Stoneham/Lac Beauport and Old Quebec. Lac St-Charles forest is at the back ! Ideal for those who loves nature. Many trails available. Only 30 seconds away on foot :). The house is under a minute from the highway (73), public transport and a biking trail. 200 meters from two plazas including the Carrefour du Lac St-Charles (Dollarama, Metro Plus, Uniprix, SAQ, Resto-Claire). Brunet, jewel shop, a gym, several gaz stations, many restaurants, garages and a church. All in easy and safe walking distance. 7 min - 5 km - Sibéria Station Spa 6 min - 5 km - Golf de la Faune 9 min - 7 km - Centre de Ski Le Relais 12 min - 14 km - Station Touristique Stoneham 15 min - 17 km - Old Quebec (Chateau Frontenac, Plaines d'Abraham, Museums) 15 min - 14 km - Village Vacances Valcartier 20 min - 28 k
host_about: Hi future travelers, I'm happy you stumbled up on my listings and may enjoy a night or many in my rentals. I'm very happy to be part of Airbnb community and help people from all over the world discover every inch of it and provide them with the comfort of a roof for a very affordable price. Wishing you a great stay and many amazing discoveries while travelling.

name: Superbe appartement 4 CC neuf 3e Ave
description:
***NEW*** STUNNING completely new apartment in the heart of Limoilou. Spacious and decorated to the taste of the day with 4 bedrooms that can accommodate up to 12 people.
4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, 1 living room with sofa bed for two people, kitchen with all amenities.
Very lively area where you will find restaurants, bars, terraces, artisans, local traders, grocery store, pharmacy and parks.
All within 10 minutes of Old Quebec by car.
neighborhood_overview:
The LIMOILOU NEIGHBORHOOD

With its perpendicular streets and avenues, the neighborhood's organization is modelled on New York. By " climbing " the 3rd Avenue, between the 2nd and 16th Streets, we meet a host of small shops that make you want to stop : delicatessen, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea room, glacier... In summer, part of the 3rd Avenue is exclusively pedestrian on weekends in the afternoon.

visit QUÉBEC-CITÉ.COM

name: La Maisonnette
description: 309503. This charming little detached house was formerly a typical stable of old Quebec. Now on the ground floor the kitchen, dining room and living room are open concept. There is the sofa bed. Underfloor heating makes this space very cozy in winter. Upstairs are 2 comfortable and intimate bedrooms, each with a Queen bed. There is also the bathroom and washer dryer. A jewel of tranquility ideally located, almost next to the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The location is very central, in the upper town, 2 minutes from the famous Château Frontenac and the charming terrace Dufferin from where the view is remarkable on the St. Lawrence River. The Dufferin Terrace and Fairytale Castle are two attractions that continue to amaze visitors and residents, offering spectacular views of the St. Lawrence River and its ever-changing ice landscapes in winter and sailing boats in summer. The street is very quiet but you are at the heart of the tourist activity and anything can be done on foot.

name: Lofts de la Barricade | By  Lofts Vieux-Qc | BA502
description: Les Lofts de la Barricade are located in a heritage building that was entirely renovated in 2023. Nevertheless, its historical value has been cautiously preserved, so you can enjoy our modern apartments while admiring their bare brick walls, beams and abundant fenestration that contribute to the charm of this place. Our rooftop terrace boasts unique views on the Saint-Lawrence River, Old Port and the famous Château Frontenac.
neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

Visit Quebec City and stay in a unique 3 bedroom apartment, ideally located in the Montcalm district in downtown Quebec City.
A short walk from all the amenities of Cartier Street and 15 minutes from the Plains of Abraham.

neighborhood_overview:
The Old Quebec Area is a 8 minute drive/14 minute bus drive/23 minute walk through the beautiful neighborhood of Saint-Jean Baptiste from our apartment is you go towards Place d’Youville.
If you go toward the Plains of Abraham is a 4 minute drive away/ 10 minute walk from our place.

A perfect balance between bourgeois and bohemian, the Montcalm district brings together epicureans, athletes and art and culture lovers in a magnificent historical environment. Head to Haute-Ville for a colorful and flavorful experience!

Bookstores, theater, museum, cinema, art galleries: in Montcalm, there is everything you need to satisfy culture lovers. Not to be missed is the Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec (MNBAQ), a veritable architectural jewel that showcases Quebec and international art. To keep up with the latest cinematographic news, we head to the Cinéma Cartier, the only cinema in the city centre and a strong run on weekends.

description:

neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is Quebec City's trendy area. I advise you to take a walk on 3rd Avenue, an atmosphere of joie de vivre is present and several small events are organized throughout the year on this one. There you will find everything you need.

- The best pastries;
- Several places for your coffee such as the famous Café Sobab
- Popular restaurant: Le Cendrillon, la Planque, Miyagi Thai Bistro & Sushi, Le Salsa, Soupe et Cie
- Pharmacies, grocery stores, convenience stores
- SAQ - Société des Alcools du Québec (buy your wine and alcohol)

It's more of a "local" neighborhood than "Touristy", with impressive energy! Plus, it's very close to Old Quebec:)

You are a short walk to 3rd Avenue de Limoilou and 15 to 25 min to Old Quebec and Old Port.

name: Quartier Saint-Roch avec stationnement intérieur
description:
Stay in an old industrial building from the beginning of the century whose cachet has been preserved. Enjoy this contemporary and warm condo, located on the dynamic rue Saint-Joseph offering many restaurants and shops.

You can enjoy all the major events and tourist sites on foot, bike paths and walking trails of the Saint-Charles River.

Accommodation establishment number 309619.
neighborhood_overview:
Just like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch neighborhood is a sought-after neighborhood. Food, Culture, Technology, Fashion, Nightlife:
the area is particularly popular with foodies.

Rue Saint-Joseph is one of the most popular streets in the area with its many cafes, restaurants, bakeries, delicatessens and microbreweries.

A few minutes' walk will take you to reach the mythical districts of Old Quebec (Château Frontenac), Old Port, Plains of Abraham (Summer Festival and major events)
host_about:

Nous pouvons vous renseigner avec plaisir afin que vous puissiez bien organiser vos vacances!

We are a couple from Quebec City who love to travel. We like to feel good when we arrive at a guest's home and we care that you feel good in our home! Free parking on premises for one (sometimes two) small to mid size vehicles such as minivans and SUVs.

name: La Tanière |  5 stars Modern cozy and rustic
description:
Welcome to La Tanière, a spacious and warm home that combines urban modern style with the rustic charm of the chic chalet. Nestled in the heart of nature, our home is a haven of peace for lovers of nature and tranquility.

Whether you're looking to reconnect with yourself or have an unforgettable vacation with family or friends, La Tanière is the perfect place.

Book now for an exceptional vacation experience in comfort and style
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet and peaceful area, located in the heart of nature.  Ideal for having a good time with your family or friends!
host_about:
Bonjour à vous chers voyageurs et bienvenue sur mon profil.

Mes amis me décriraient comme un voyageur nomade ayant une soif insatiable pour l’aventure, la découverte et les rencontres avec d’autres cultures.

Je suis également un passionné de photographie, mon rêve est d’un jour pouvoir en vivre toute en voyageant. J’ai peut-être oublié de vous dire que je suis un rêveur qui idéalise la vie.  

J’ai aussi un grand intérêt pour l’architecture, les rénovations et la décoration. 

J’adore aussi tous ce qui touche à la nature que ce soit les arbres, les fleurs ou les animaux, je crois que c’est le remède des sociétés modernes. 

Je suis simplement un passionné qui tente de profiter de chaque minute que la vie a à offrir et j'aimerais partager cela avec vous. 

----------

Airbnb est pour moi un aboutissement de plusieurs années à chercher la solution me permettant d’avoir un d’avoir un pied à terre, sans être esclave de l’entretien, sans la charge fiscale trop lourde d’une propriété, qui me permettrait d’avoir la liberté de voyager.

En tant q’hôte, Airbnb est un moyen formidable de voyager en restant à la maison et il permet de rencontrer des gens extraordinaires. L’ayant utilisé moi-même à de nombreuses reprises en tant que voyageur pour mes voyages autour du monde ou à des fins professionnel,  Airbnb est pour moi la meilleure façon de se sentir comme à la maison malgré la distance qui nous sépare de notre domicile. 

Ceci étant dit, je sais ce dont vous avez besoin pour vous sentir bien lors de vos séjour à l’extérieur, j’ai oeuvré en ce sens pour maximiser votre confort et vous offrir un séjour des plus conviviales. 
Si vous avez besoin de quoi que ce soit pour améliorer l’expérience n’hésitez pas à communiquer avec moi, il me fera plaisir de vous aider. 

C’est avec plaisir que je partage avec vous ma tanière, qui est mon lieu de paix dans ce monde chaotique. Soyez y bien, profitez-en et faites comme chez vous.

Mes sincères salutations, 

Christian

name: QBEDS Hostel -Amazing location! 14 Beds Mixed Dorm
description:
THE BEST HOSTEL IN TOWN!

QBEDS Hostel is ideally located on Grande-Allée street, which is undoubtedly the most popular street in Quebec city! You can find various bars, cafes and restaurants on Grande-Allee street, in the heart of downtown Quebec city. Its unique funky design and vibe will definitely make you feel like home! We have everything you have always dreamt of; a cinema room, an indoor forest with lots of hammocks, a fully equipped bar and much more!
neighborhood_overview: Grande-Allée Street is located in the heart of Old Quebec, which is where most events and festivals happen all year long. Located at a walking distance from most major attractions like the Parliament, the Château Frontenac and the Plains of Abraham, QBEDS Hostel is right in the middle of all the action! You will also find various bars, cafes and restaurants all along Grande-Allee street and the surrounding streets. This street is also part of the historic town, since it was used in the 19th century as a residential street for the rich upper-class in Quebec City. You can admire the architecture of QBEDS Hostel, which was built in 1900 by William A. Marsh, a rich salesman. You'll notice the historic aspects of our building both inside and outside the building, who was well preserved throughout the years.

name: The Palace Penthouse
description:
The place
Whether it is a business trip, a romantic getaway or a trip with friends, my sumptuous and spacious apartment is ready to make your stay in Quebec City a dream. Be captivated by the breathtaking view of my balcony plunging on the Palais station, the Old Port and its neighboring shops. The 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms will be more than enough to accommodate up to 6 of your fellow travelers. I promise you will not be disappointed!
neighborhood_overview:
My apartment is not only beautiful, it is also located close to the Gare du Palais, the bus and train station of Quebec City. This way, if you arrive here by public transport, it will take literally a few minutes before you relax in the penthouse and unwrap your luggage.

Long reserved for commercial activities, the Old Port area of Quebec now seduces residents and tourists alike. The contact with the river, the fresh air and the vast horizon make it an oasis of peace. Those who dream of departure meet the travelers freshly landed cruise ships. Lovers of relaxation or shows rub shoulders.

On one side, changing in appearance according to the seasons, the St. Lawrence River is omnipresent. It flows and can be admired for miles and in all weathers. On the other side, the city spreads its assets: the terraces seduce, the astonishing restaurants, the art galleries attract, the antiquaries captivate, the architecture, splendid, enchants. A stroll in the Old Port district

neighborhood_overview:
Like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch district is a sought-after place. Food, culture, technology, fashion, nightlife :
the area is particularly popular with foodies.

St. Joseph Street is one of the most popular streets in the neighborhood with its many cafes, restaurants, bakeries, delicatessens and microbreweries.

A few minutes walk will suffice to reach the mythical neighborhoods of Old Quebec (Château Frontenac), the Old Port, the Plains of Abraham (Summer Festival and major events)

neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Jean-Baptiste, often called Faubourg Saint-Jean, is a district of Quebec City within the borough of La Cité–Limoilou. It is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City, the old part remaining corresponding to the old working-class neighbourhood organized around the Saint Jean Baptiste church while the newer part is occupied mainly by the Quebec government and large hotels. Several important monuments are part of this neighborhood.

- Centre des congrets
- Parliament
- Place Hauteville and Observatory
- Quebec City Convention Center
- Place de la Capitale
- Maison de Radio-Canada
- Martello Tower no. 4
- J. A. Moisan grocery store
All within a 5-minute walk

You will find many important shopping streets nearby, including Saint-Joseph Street, Saint-Vallier Street East and West and Cartier Avenue in Haute-Ville. Charming apartment on 3rd Avenue in the Limoilou neighborhood. Spacious and warm with 2 bedrooms that can accommodate up to 8 people (6 adults, 2 children).
Large living room with a sofa bed for two people, kitchen with full amenities.
Very lively neighborhood where you will find restaurants, bars, terraces, craftsmen, local shops, grocery store, pharmacy and parks.
All within 10 minutes of Vieux-Qc by car (20 min. by public transport, less than 30 min. on foot).
neighborhood_overview:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD LIMOILOU

With its streets and avenues perpendicular, the organization of the neighborhood is modeled on New York. By « going up » 3rd Avenue, between 2nd and 16th Streets, you will come across a host of small shops that make you want to stop : delicatessen, bakeries, cafes, craft shops, art galleries, tea room, glacier... In summer, part of 3rd Avenue is exclusively pedestrian on weekends in the afternoon.

VISIT QUÉBEC-CITÉ.COM

name: Le308 - Close to Old Quebec (Free Parking)
description:
Welcome to our condo in the heart of Quebec City's Lower Town, where charm and convenience meet. Nearby: shops, restaurants, and performance venues. Explore the city easily with many bus lines available. Stay with us for an unforgettable experience.

CITQ:297350

Traveling with a group? We own another unit in the same building. Here’s the link to access it:

airbnb.fr/h/le201
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Quebec City's lower town, our condo offers easy access to numerous small shops, neighborhood restaurants, and even theaters. Furthermore, the city's must-see attractions are within a 10-minute drive, including Old Quebec (1.5 km away), the Plains of Abraham (2.3 km), Old Port of Quebec (2.6 km), Château Frontenac (3 km), the Centre Vidéotron (3.5 km), the Grand Marché de Québec (3.5 km), Montmorency Falls (13.6 km), Place Laurier (8.3 km), the Quebec Aquarium (11.6 km), and much more. Enjoy a central location to explore all the treasures of our beautiful tourist city.

description:
Nicely renovated appartment located at the junction of St-Sacrement and Montcalm neighborhoods. It is a very safe and calm neighborhood. Arguably the nicest of Québec city. You won't be far from all the major attractions of the city.

The appartment is on the first floor of an old 8 units buiding located on a busy street. It can be a little bit noisy sometimes, but not enough to cause any problem. Sadly, we can’t control that. There are two parkings for you including one with an EV Charger.

There is two private parking spaces and a spacious backyard.
It is a walking distance to the largest shopping mall in Quebec City and CHUL Hospital, and only a 5 minute drive from Université Laval.
Great location!

name: Maison de prestige. Vieux-Québec
description:
Gloriously nestled in the west wing of Château Frontenac and nestled between Parc-du-Cavalier and Jardin des Gouverneurs, this house from 1783 was classified as historic in 1967. Property of the 1st Mayor of the City of Quebec. It offers 7000pc on 5 floors, 3 queen bed bedrooms, 1 double bedroom and 1 single bed room + 2 bathrooms and 2 shower rooms. The view of the river allows the occupants a certain zen out of sight. This heritage jewel of Quebec City is provided.

name: T402- Les Lofts du Trésor - Par Les Lofts Vieux-Qc
description:
Experience Old Québec City in a Loft that highlights the history of a freshly renovated 1907 building. To make your stay even more pleasant, you have access to the rooftop patio with the best view in Québec City overlooking the Château Frontenac and St-Lawrence River.
Fully equipped kitchen, dining area, comfy living room and your own washer & dryer to enhance your experience!
Elevator on site.
neighborhood_overview:
In front of the Basilica-cathedral Notre-Dame de Québec, a couple of doors from the famous Château Frontenac, and located directly in front of the numerous artists showcasing their art outside, Les Lofts du Trésor will make you live an authentic and unforgettable Québécois experience.
You will find within a few minutes walk dozens of restaurants, cafés and shops. You truly are in the heart of Old Québec and will feel the french canadian hospitality at its best!
host_about:
The leader in vacation rental apartments in Québec City. We opened our first location in 2015 with the Lofts St-Joseph, a 18-unit building situated in the very vibrant neighborhood of St-Roch. We now have beautiful and cosy Lofts in all of Quebec’s neighborhoods with over a dozen locations that include more than 120 vacation apartments.
We are changing the hospitality business by offering short term rental apartments that suit the needs of today’s travellers with fully furnished kitchens, multiple bedrooms units and living room to sit back and relax.
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec offers you the possibility to experience and visit Québec City with the comfort of your own home.
Make sure to check our different locations or contact us for any questions.

Large home with 3 bedrooms, 3 beds, 1 large bright living room, fully equipped kitchen. Perfect for relaxing!

Apartment located in the heart of Quebec City, very quiet friendly area easily accessible from the main highways.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is easily accessible from major roads and by public transport (subway line 801).

It is in a residential area of the Limoilou district, and close to all services such as grocery stores, restaurants, Centre Vidéotron and Grand Marché.

Limoilou is a booming area of the city, which sees many trendy shops and restaurants: La Planque, Le Cinderella and beautiful micro-breweries : La Souche, Brasserie Générale, SNO Nordik.

Urban Park within walking distance: Place Jean-Béliveau and Saint-Charles River Linear Park.
host_about:
Utilisatrice de Airbnb en voyage, j'étais hôte dans mon ancienne maison ! Maintenant installer dans une nouvelle demeure, je souhaite poursuivre en tant que hôte. 
J'adore l'expérience de recevoir, permettre aux voyageurs d'avoir un appartement, un pied à terre. Surtout faire découvrir ma belle ville de Québec !
Sportive, gourmande et aimant l'urbanisme, n'hésitez pas à demander conseils pour des lieux à découvrir en dehors des incontournables.

name: Entire Townhouse on Historic rue Champlain
description:
Watch the sunrise over the impressive Saint Lawrence seaway as you enjoy your morning coffee or afternoon apéro while sitting at your own personal bistro table just outside your front door!

This cozy and romantic townhouse was built circa 1860 and rests along a beautiful, quiet, historic street in the heart of Québec City which runs just along-side the water.

Close enough to all of the fun tourist attractions but removed enough to have a real local experience.
neighborhood_overview: This is our primary residence, and we take great pride in our home and our neighborhood. We have THE BEST neighbors ever, so don't be afraid to say bonjour! From our home you are only a ten minute stroll to Petit Champlain, just across the street from the public pool and the stunning, new nordic spa; Strom. We are also a two minute walk from les escaliers du Cap Blanc (the Cap Blanc stairs), which bring you right up to the Citadel and the Plains of Abraham.

description: Superb apartment with private parking, centrally located. Available for monthly rental (31 day +). Located on the ground floor, with private backyard (& patio), quality furniture, refined accessories and art, all wrapped up in a modern and minimalist decor. Close to all services. neighborhood_overview:
Though it would be a crime to miss Quebec City's main attractions, visiting the surrounding neighbourhoods, the ones that aren't brimming with tourists, is an excellent way to flesh out a vacation in this unique and historical Canadian city. Saint-Roch is one place to start if you want to check out an authentic part of Quebec City where locals gather. St-Roch has an unique identity and vibe all of its own.

"Nouvo Saint-Roch" (New Saint-Roch) was gentrified in recent years into a haven for hipsters, students and techies. Much like Griffintown in Montreal, Gastown in Vancouver or Brooklyn in New York, Saint-Roch has seen its warehouses, garages and stockrooms become boutiques, breweries and cafes.
host_about:
Québécoise passionnée par les voyages. J'ai habité 4 ans à Reno, au Nevada (USA), pour mes études et 2 ans en France, à Paris  dans le 3e arrondissement pour le travail. 

Je loue souvent via airbnb dans le monde entier et je propose aussi mon condo à Québec.

J'ai une panoplie de recommandations à vous faire dans les quartiers les plus branchés et convoités de la ville, que ce soit pour des sorties ou des activités au centre-ville, ou aux alentours : vélo, ski alpin, raquette, concerts, restaurants, cafés, musées, bistros, shopping, pubs et plus.

Je suis une amoureuse de ma ville et elle me le rend bien !

**

I am passionate about travelling. I am French-Canadian and I live in Quebec City. I have also lived in Reno, Nevada for my studies and in Paris, France for work.

I have many recommandations for fun activities in town and around the city : skiing, snowshoeing, biking, concerts, restaurants, pubs, shopping, museums, etc. !

I'm a happy, easy-going and fun person who loves traveling and meeting new people through AirBnB both a host and a guest.

**
