name: QUEBEC GRAND APPARTEMENT
description: Licence - ( 295750 ) Discover the beautiful city of Quebec and its charming Old Quebec. A large NEWLY REFRESHED apartment with 2 large bedrooms for your comfort and tranquility in the heart of the city center. Welcome, everyone.
neighborhood_overview: The Saint-Roch neighbourhood is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Quebec City. A constantly buzzing neighborhood combining media technology and cultural life with its trendy Rue Saint-Joseph (libraries, theatres, theatre, shops and very friendly restaurants and bars), all to make your stay as pleasant as possible.
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple mixte et nous vivons à Québec. Nous aimons la vie sous toutes ses formes : bien manger, boire, dormir, flâner, écouter de la musique et beaucoup bricoler et partager. 
Pour nous le contact est primordial, il nous nourrit. Rencontrer du monde de partout et leur offrir notre univers est ce que nous avons de plus précieux et c'est pourquoi nous sommes ici. 

We are a mixed couple and we live in Quebec City. We love life in all its forms: eating well, drinking, sleeping, strolling, listening to music, tinkering and sharing.
For us the contact is primordial, it nourishes us. To meet people from all over the world and to offer them our universe is what we have most precious and that is why we are on this platform.

name: Charmante maison au coeur du Vieux Québec
description:
Charming ancestral house (1820) on 2 floors, well maintained and renovated, in the heart of Old Quebec. OUTDOOR TERRACE. QUIET and SAFE PLACE. Located just steps from St-Jean Street and Place d 'Youville, close to major bus routes, many restaurants and shops.

The house is perfect for couples, families and business travelers. It can accommodate up to 6 people (2 beds + 1 sofa bed).

host_about:
Nous sommes résidents du Vieux Québec, un quartier que nous aimons et que nous désirons faire découvrir.
Nous habitons tout près de la résidence louée, de sorte que nous invitons nos locataires à montrer de la civilité dans l’usage des lieux de manière à réduire les inconvénients pour le voisinage. 
De manière plus générale, nous sommes soucieux de faire en sorte que le tourisme puisse se développer dans notre quartier dans le respect de la vie de ses résidents.

name: Family Friendly Apartment - Old Quebec
description: In town for work, to study, for a vacation or to visit relatives? You will feel right at home in our charming condo. Our place is confortable, spacious, bright and fully equipped. Located on a UNESCO World Heritage site, mere steps from everything, its picturesque location will enchant you. Monthly booking only.
neighborhood_overview:
Here you are in the heart of Old Québec, mere steps from Le Château Frontenac, Les Plaines d'Abraham, Place Royale, Le Petit Champlain, Le Funiculaire, La Rue St-Jean, restaurants, cafés, theatres, art galleries, shops, pubs, grocery & liquor stores, public transportation, bike trails... There is SO MUCH to see and do. Please review our Guidebook; we have listed many of the major attractions and our favourite local spots.

We have a 31 night minimum booking policy and to help you immerse yourself as quickly as possible in the community, our Guidebook also include all the essential places you'll need to go to cover the basics of everyday living. And because everything is walking distance we have left a trolley for you to use to carry your packages back to the condo!

Looking for something specific that is not on the list? Email me and I'll be more than happy to research it for you.

neighborhood_overview:
Grande-Allée:

Nicknamed the Champs Élysées of Quebec, Grande-Allée is famous for its numerous restaurants, bars, and terraces. It’s a nightlife hub where one can find legendary establishments such as:

Le Patio du Festibière: A new festive & casual bar on Grande-Allée. A typically local spot that’s unpretentious with an unmatched atmosphere! THE place for those who love to enjoy the best of summer all year round!
Le Dagobert: A historic multi-story nightclub.
Les Voûtes de Napoléon: A singer-songwriter bar to enjoy Quebec folk music.
L’Atelier: A chic restaurant-bar known for its mixology.
Faite à l’os: Master of the grill, Faite à l’os offers the typical American barbecue experience.
Plains of Abraham:

A historic site that was the scene of the battle between the French and the English in 1759. Today, it’s a large park where one can stroll, picnic, and enjoy cultural events.

neighborhood_overview: For families (and adults with a young heart), it is possible to slide and skate for free a few meters from the house in winter. You will discover the pleasures of winter. Whatever the season, be sure to visit Jacques Cartier Beach near the Cap-Rouge nautical park.
host_about:
J'aime écouter les gens. Écouter pour apprendre, pour découvrir. Sportive de nature. Des sports d'équipe (soccer, volleyball, etc.) aux sports de plein air (escalade, randonnée, canot, etc.). J'adore apprendre des langues. La plus belle façon de voyager à mon avis est d'apprendre le plus de mots possibles dans la langue du pays visité. Ça permet d'avoir un contact privilégié avec les gens du pays et une expérience plus riche.

Nous offrons notre résidence familiale en location aux visiteurs lorsque nous sommes en voyages à l'extérieur de la ville.

------
I like listening to people. Listen to learn, to discover. Sporty nature. From team sports (soccer, volleyball, etc.) to outdoor sports (climbing, hiking, canoeing, etc.). I love learning languages. The best way to travel in my opinion is to learn as many words as possible in the language of the country visited. It allows to have a privileged contact with the people of the country and a richer experience.

We offer our family home for rent to visitors when we are traveling outside the city.

------
Me gusta escuchar a la gente Escucha para aprender, para descubrir. Soy deportiva. Desde deportes de equipo (fútbol, voleibol, etc.) hasta deportes al aire libre (escalada, senderismo, piragüismo, etc.). Me encanta aprender idiomas. La mejor manera de viajar, en mi opinión, es aprender tantas palabras como sea posible en el idioma del país visitado. Permite tener un contacto privilegiado con la gente del país y una experiencia más rica.

Ofrecemos nuestra casa familiar para alquilar a los visitantes cuando viajamos fuera de la ciudad.

name: Le 315B Locations Vieux Limoilou "with parking"
description: The 315B is a comfortable apartment loved by visitors. It is bathed in light in summer and winter. It is in the heart of a lively, authentic and very safe neighborhood. It is located a few minutes from old Quebec. Discover the many restaurants in the area or take your meal on our pretty terrace. You have the chance to  discover a very friendly neighbourhood that vibrates with its distinctive character.
neighborhood_overview: The old Limoilou district (former working-class district) stands out from the other districts by its architecture from the beginning of 1800, the proximity of the Cartier Brébeuf park, its local shops, its many restaurants and its simplicity. It is a place where life is good during all seasons. 3rd avenue has seen the birth of many new businesses in the last 5 years, which makes Limoilou a place coveted by Quebecers and tourists.
host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

neighborhood_overview: The Quartier Petit Champlain is known as one of the most beautiful site of North America. Located at the bottom of the cliff under the Château Frontenac, this authentic area is a “must see” when visiting Quebec. Petit-Champlain street, is one of the oldest commercial street in North America. Particularly magical during winter, illuminated by thousands of lights, the pedestrian streets offer a variety of interesting shops and restaurants in a romantic setting in every season. Furthermore, for the music, humor and theater lovers, you can also enjoy a show in the historical Theater Petit Champlain.

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

- Amazing restaurant such as Le Cendrillon, la Planque, Miyagi Bistro thaï & Sushi, Le Salsa, Soupe et Cie

It is more of a locals place than tourist one which makes you see the real side of Quebec City.

Moreover, you are still only 5-10 minutes by car and 15-25 minutes by walk from Old Quebec city and the Old port.

name: Le Alexis + Le Béluga | WorkDesk&Wifi | Balcony&AC
description:
Discover Quebec City in one of its most trendy neighbourhoods : Saint-Roch!
CITQ 305262

✧ Located near shops, restaurants and bars
✧ Plenty of paid parking options at walking distance
✧ Free street parking option on parallel street to ours at less than 5 minutes walk
✧ Recently renovated and updated
✧ 4 bedrooms with queen beds
✧ 2 full bathrooms
✧ Fully equipped kitchen
✧ Washer and dryer in the unit
✧ 40-inch smart TV for listening to Netflix!
✧ Private terrace to enjoy your coffee
neighborhood_overview:
Like Griffintown in Montreal or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, the Saint-Roch district has gone from a working-class neighbourhood to a sought-after place in just a few years. Food, culture, technology, fashion, nightlife: discover Quebec City's Lowertown in its most popular spots!

To go shopping, eat in the last restaurant everyone is talking about, sip a drink in a pub or watch the most popular show of the moment, it's in Saint-Roch that we go!

The area is particularly popular with foodies: the excellent tables are next to the small neighbourhood restaurants where you can eat well at a very good price, while the microbreweries have the wind in their sails and brew refreshing original beers. Don't forget to visit a delicatessen to take the local terroir home!

In the summer, young web and video game professionals mingle with students for an outdoor dinner in the Jean-Paul-L'Allier garden, a veritable oasis of greenery in the heart of the city.

In

host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

neighborhood_overview:
Quiet neighborhood. Located very close to a park. Nearby restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies and shopping mall.

This large 1300pm. apartment, on the ground level, in a house , is located very close to a park as well as a newly renovated historic monument ( former prison). You can admire the sunsets of the house with the monument in the background! There are grocery stores, pharmacies as well as several restaurants within walking distance. There are 3 shopping malls located on Boulevard Laurier a few minutes by car or bus. The Bois de Coulonge Park is a 10-minute walk away. It is very large and dotted with historic buildings. Don't forget the famous Champlain promenade located on the banks of the St-Lawrence River, its observatories will give a fantastic view of our beautiful city!

neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Limoilou. At a walking distance you'll find on the 3rd avenue restaurants of any kind (Sushi, soup, local cuisine, Irish pub, etc.) drugstores, liquor stores (SAQ), beer stores, gourmet stores, coffee places, etc.

Just crossing the bridge on the 3rd avenue (rue du pont/pont Dorchester), you get to St-Roch and St-Joseph Street wich is a vibrant place in the lower part of the city. This will get you to the Old Port wich is about 15 to 20 minutes walking from the appartement.

We're also surrounded by lots of parks (Parc Cartier Bréboeuf, Parc Victoria, Parc Pointe-au-lièvres). It's a 5 minutes walk to the St-Charles river walk wich is one of the very best place to go for a nice walk/run, bicycle ride and even cross-country skiing during winter.

Welcome to "le Sky - Penthouse"
In the heart of the St-Roch district, a stone's throw from Old Quebec,
this condo is ideally located.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the charming St-Roch district in Quebec City! This historic neighborhood is located in the heart of the city, offering visitors a unique and authentic experience.
During the day, you can explore the many boutiques, art galleries, and restaurants that line the streets. Stop by the Marché du Vieux-Port to sample fresh produce and local delicacies or take a stroll along the Saint-Charles River. For those who love history, St-Roch is home to several museums and historic sites, such as the Église Saint-Roch, a beautiful neo-Gothic church.
The steps to Old Quebec are on Fleury Street behind the building and allow you to reach the old town in 15 minutes on foot!
Old Quebec, one of the most picturesque and charming neighborhoods in all of North America. Our Airbnb is located in the heart of this UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering visitors a chance to step back in time and experience the rich history and culture of Quebec City.

host_about: Nous habitons Québec. Notre maison se trouve dans les montagnes. Nous avons longtemps habité au centre-ville de Québec. J'aime le ski, le patin, le yoga et la marche en montagne. Je suis une artiste peintre et mon mari est musicien. Nous avons 2 enfants et un gros chats. Les voyages sont devenus compliqués avec les multiples allergies de mon plus jeune et Airbnb nous a permis de voyager sans danger pour lui. Nous pouvons voyager sans avoir à manger toujours dans les restaurants ou payer une suite dans les hôtels.

name: Le Bouleau | Parking | Pool & BBQ | Office & AC
description:
Come and enjoy an unforgettable stay in the heart of the Saint-Roch district in Quebec City. This modern and luxurious condo will charm you as much by its common spaces as by its interior design.


✧️ Parking space provided
✧️ Roof terrace with pool & outdoor fireplace
✧️ BBQ and dining area
✧️ Fitness room
✧️ Bright and pleasant apartment
✧️ Fast wifi and work space
✧️ Just a 15 minute walk to Old Quebec
neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is a trendy neighborhood with many small restaurants, cafes and lively bars. It is also home to boutiques selling clothing, home goods and toys along St. Joseph Street. Concert halls, theaters and contemporary art galleries dot the area. The Jean-Paul-L'Allier Garden features an artificial waterfall, and the huge Saint-Roch Church is nearby.


↣ Chute de Montmorency only 13 minutes away
↣ Wendake reserve and its forest hikes only 20 minutes away
↣ Old Quebec and its cobblestone streets at 15 minutes by foot or 5 minutes by car
↣ The famous Christmas Boutique of Quebec City at only 15 minutes walking distance

description:
Come and enjoy an unforgettable stay in the heart of the Saint-Roch district in Quebec City. This modern and luxurious condo will charm you as much by its common spaces as by its interior design.


✧️ Private parking space provided
✧️ Roof terrace with pool & outdoor fireplace
✧️ BBQ and dining area

✧️ Bright and pleasant apartment

neighborhood_overview:
Saint-Roch is a trendy neighborhood with many small restaurants, cafes and lively bars. It is also home to boutiques selling clothing, home goods and toys along St. Joseph Street. Concert halls, theaters and contemporary art galleries dot the area. The Jean-Paul-L'Allier Garden features an artificial waterfall, and the huge Saint-Roch Church is nearby.


↣ Chute de Montmorency only 13 minutes away
↣ Wendake reserve and its forest hikes only 20 minutes away
↣ Old Quebec and its cobblestone streets at 15 minutes by foot or 5 minutes by car
↣ The famous Christmas Boutique of Quebec City at only 15 minutes walking distance
↣ The Citadel of Quebec City 6 minutes away by car

Sao.

neighborhood_overview: Saint-Joseph is probably the most attractive neighborhood on the city, it is urban and hip. Its central location will allow you to get anywhere very easily. Getting to the Old Québec and Petit Champlain is very easy from there.  You won't get bored with everything there is to do there. Indeed, it's also close to the Central train station !

neighborhood_overview: The Saint-Sauveur neighborhood is a dynamic gem at the heart of Quebec City. Known for its vibrant and friendly vibe, this urban enclave offers a variety of local shops, delicious restaurants, and scenic cafes. Tree-lined streets invite you to walk, while parks offer green spaces to relax. Street art and cultural events animate the streets, creating a unique artistic atmosphere. With a lively nightlife and a warm community, Saint-Sauveur is the perfect place to experience the hustle and bustle of Quebec City.
host_about: Je suis un hôte et voyageur passionné. J'adore offrir une expérience de séjour inoubliable à mes invités et découvrir de nouveaux endroits à travers le monde. J'ai hâte de vous accueillir dans mon logement ou de rester chez vous lors de mon prochain voyage!

name: Le 1064 | Mon appart Urbain | Limoilou
description:
Located in the heart of the very lively Limoilou district, the place is ideal for living the neighborhood life and discovering the good restaurants and cafes of 3rd Avenue and Quebec City.

The apartment includes 2 double beds and 1 queen bed, a full bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen.

**Note that the listing is located close to several nightlife attractions, including bars and restaurants. That said, the possibility of noise is present.
host_about:
Chers futurs guests,

J’adore voyager et je suis donc souvent absent. À mes yeux la meilleure façon de découvrir une ville est en y vivant comme quelqu’un de local et cela passe, bien entendu, par le logement. C’est dans cette optique que lors de mes voyages je laisse mon logement à disposition des voyageurs du monde entier, alors : pourquoi pas vous ?  :)

Pas d’inquiétude, même si je ne suis pas présent lors de vos réservations, Exode Bnb, à laquelle j’ai confié la gestion de mon logement, saura rendre votre séjour aussi agréable que possible !

A très vite,

David.

Dear future guests,

I love travelling, so I’m often absent. For me, the best way to get to know a city is by living there like a local person, and this can only be done, of course, by getting accommodation. It is with this in mind that whenever I am travelling, I make my lodging facility available to travelers from around the world, so: why not you?

Don’t worry, even if I’m not present when you are doing the booking arrangement, Exode Bnb, to whom I have entrusted the management of my home, will make your stay as enjoyable as possible!

See you soon,

David.

host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis Hélène la co-propriétaire de Locations Vieux Limoilou.

Je vous présente un concept d'hébergement court terme différent. 3 appartements et 2 studios tendances. 
L'opportunité de découvrir  la ville de Québec en vivant quelques jours dans un quartier authentique.
Découvrir ses restaurants, boutiques, cafés, bars et attractions.

Mon mari Pedro et moi sommes des adeptes de locations sur Airbnb depuis plusieurs années. Nous avons profité de nos expériences pour mettre sur pied ce concept simple et à la fois parfait.

Nous sommes natifs de Québec et établis à Limoilou depuis 20 ans.

Nous comprenons bien les besoins des voyageurs et serons prêts à vous accueillir pour votre séjour peu importe la saison.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions.
Au plaisir de vous rencontrer! 

Please do not hesitate to contact us we speak English. 
Hablamos Español si queréis informaciones.

name: Super condo avec mezzanine et terrasse
description:
You'll stay in the city's most pleasant area! You are close to several shops such as cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies, clothes, etc. If you want to live with locals and see how Quebecers live, while being a 5-minute walk from the fortifications, this is the place!

This great condo with mezzanine overlooking the kitchen and the living room will satisfy you as much by its terrace on a green roof as the proximity of Old Quebec.
neighborhood_overview:
You are close to these sectors:
1. The old fortifications located in the Upper Town: This is the neighborhood everyone will visit. At first, the fortifications were for protection from the English, now it's to keep tourists inside;) Anyway, this neighborhood is super beautiful, you'll love it. On the other hand, this is mainly for tourism. You can buy a "J 'AIME LE QUÉBEC" t-shirt.

2. Le Faubourg St-Jean-Baptiste which is right next to the fortifications: This neighborhood is mine and soon yours, even if you don't choose my place. I would highly recommend this neighborhood. Here, you'll live with the locals. St. John Street is a beautiful street for St. John Street where you'll find everything you need without even using your car. This street will take you straight into the fortifications which are a 10-minute walk from your home.

name: Superbe condo avec 4 grandes chambres
description: Welcome to this beautiful newly renovated condo, conveniently located in the heart of the city! This spacious basement apartment has four large bedrooms that can accommodate up to eight people, perfect for families or friends. It also contains a bathroom and shower room. neighborhood_overview:
This condo strategically located in Quebec City is a perfect choice for your quiet stay! Just a 15-minute drive from Old Quebec, this neighborhood offers an ideal balance between proximity to tourist attractions and residential tranquility.

Exploring Old Quebec, you'll be immersed in history with its cobblestone streets, fortifications, and charming cafes. The majestic Château Frontenac and Place Royale are only a few kilometers away, easily accessible from your home.

For nature lovers, the Plains of Abraham, an expansive urban park famous for its historical events, are just a 15 minute drive away. For foodies, renowned restaurants and local shops are just steps away, offering a variety of cuisines and flavors to discover.

Enjoy the serenity and friendliness of this condo while having quick and convenient access to Quebec City's iconic attractions. It's the perfect place to experience the city and make you feel right at home.

name: Magnifique maison de ville dans le Vieux-Québec!
description: Our townhouse is perfect for a group of friends, family or workers. Conveniently located, you will be within minutes walking of the most wonderful attractions of Old Quebec. The famous Château Frontenac, the festive Rue Saint-Jean, the Plains of Abraham, the turbulent Grande Allée and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
Quebec City is divided into three main areas:
Downtown, commonly called "la Basse-Ville": When you stay in this area, you need to go up to the Haute-Ville.
Upper Town includes Old Quebec and Le Faubourg St-Jean-Baptiste:
Old Quebec with its old fortifications. This is the neighborhood everyone will visit. Formerly, the fortifications were used to protect themselves from the English, now it's to keep tourists inside;) In short, this area is superb, you'll love it. It is mainly for tourism. You can buy an "I LOVE QUÉBEC" t-shirt and other souvenirs in the many shops there.
The Faubourg Saint-Jean-Baptiste is next to the fortifications. And this is where my property is located. Here, you'll live with the locals. Rue Saint-Jean is a beautiful shopping street where you can walk and enjoy the lively atmosphere. This street will take you straight into the fortifications, a 5-minute walk from your home.

name: At Napoleon's | In the heart of old Quebec City
description:
Visit Old Quebec and stay in a historic building that was a printing press in the early 1900s, then an office space for architects after the 1980s.

In the heart of Old Quebec, all historical sites are within walking distance (Château Frontenac, Terrasse Dufferin, Place Royale, Notre-Dame-des-Anges, Plains of Abraham, and more).

We are surrounded by some of the best restaurants in Quebec City.
neighborhood_overview: We are in the main historic district of Quebec City, on a street with many art galleries, restaurants and pretty shops. About a 2-minute walk from the funicular, you'll reach Château Frontenac and Terrace Dufferin in no time. Along the way, you'll cross Rue du Petit-Champlain, which is the oldest commercial artery in North America.
host_about: Nous prenons plaisir à vous faire vivre des moments magiques dans des résidences au goût du jour de la région de Charlevoix et de Québec !

CITQ: 298206
host_about:
Bonjour ! Nous sommes Tommy et Vicky, un jeune (vieux) couple  formé depuis notre secondaire. C'est notre passion pour les voyages et les nouvelles expériences qui nous ont amenés à louer notre condo pour des voyageurs/travailleurs souhaitant découvrir notre belle ville. Depuis notre adolescence, Vicky et moi avons été constamment au service de la clientèle, travaillant tous les deux dans le domaine de la restauration. Notre plaisir à rendre notre clientèle satisfaite n'a jamais disparu, Vicky étant aujourd'hui coiffeuse et moi pompier. Je n'ai donc pas besoin de vous dire à quel point il nous ferait plaisir de vous recevoir chez nous ! :) Nous vous garantissons d'être à l'écoute, courtois et de faire tout ce qui est en notre possible afin de rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible !

À bientôt !

Tommy et Vicky

neighborhood_overview: On the edge of the Saint-Roch and Saint-Sauveur districts, animated by a host of neighborhood shops, shopping streets where cafes, bakeries, grocery stores, restaurants, bars and local shops. host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

This is a great neighborhood for students and families looking for a quiet atmosphere and close to urban amenities.

name: Proche, pratique, paisible !
description:
You will be in Quebec City for a few days and want to feel more at home than a hotel? Come enjoy our house and the charm of Limoilou, not far from Old Quebec.

In a quiet area, close to the city center (15 minutes by bus), our house will allow you to discover the old town, the port, but also to enjoy the attractions of Quebec City's less touristy neighborhoods, its small shops, its walk along the Saint Charles River... A real slice of paradise!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in the Lairet district, in Limoilou.

It's 5 minutes away:
- the historic center of Vieux-Limoilou and its small shops and restaurants,
- the Grand Marché de Québec where you can find a multitude of local products,
- the Videotron Center if you'd like to attend a show,
- from the Saint-Charles River if you want to stretch your legs.

It is 10' by car, 20' by bus and 30' by bike (rental station 100 M AWAY) from Vieux Québec and Le Vieux Port. It is also located 300 m from a metrobus (major bus axis) which allows you to reach any place of the big city.
host_about:
Si je me suis inscrite sur Airbnb, c'est avant tout parce que j'adore la ville qu'est Québec, et que, pour avoir beaucoup voyagé, je crois qu'il est très important de pouvoir se sentir un peu chez soi après une longue journée de visite, de marche et de découvertes. Donc quoi de plus normal de vous faire partager mon petit havre de paix quand je m'en vais en voyage ?!

J'espère que vous aurez autant de plaisir à y poser vos valises que j'en ai à mettre la clé dans la porte chaque soir, et surtout, que vous apprécierez Québec comme elle le mérite !
Cette ville regorge de petits coins qui font sourire, de détours qui permettent d'ouvrir les yeux sur le monde, et évidemment, de gens de qualité, des idéalistes, des travailleurs, des rêveurs, des gens qui rient, qui sourient, et qui seront, j'en suis sûre, près à vous orienter, à vous aiguiller, à vous donner leur bonnes adresses et coups de coeur, à condition que vous preniez le temps de leur dire bonjour !

name: QBEDS Hostel -Amazing location! 8 Beds Mixed Dorm
description:
THE BEST HOSTEL IN TOWN!

QBEDS Hostel is ideally located on Grande-Allée street, which is undoubtedly the most popular street in Quebec City! You can find various bars, cafes and restaurants on Grande-Allee street, in the heart of downtown Quebec City. Its unique funky design and vibe will definitely make you feel like home! We have everything you have always dreamt of; a cinema room, an indoor forest with lots of hammocks, a fully equipped bar and much more!
neighborhood_overview: Grande-Allée Street is located in the heart of Old Quebec, which is where most events and festivals happen all year long. Located at a walking distance from most major attractions like the Parliament, the Château Frontenac and the Plains of Abraham, QBEDS Hostel is right in the middle of all the action! You will also find various bars, cafes and restaurants all along Grande-Allee street and the surrounding streets. This street is also part of the historic town, since it was used in the 19th century as a residential street for the rich upper-class in Quebec City. You can admire the architecture of QBEDS Hostel, which was built in 1900 by William A. Marsh, a rich salesman. You'll notice the historic aspects of our building both inside and outside the building, who was well preserved throughout the years.

name: Initial | Époque | Ville de Québec
description:
Perfectly located in the heart of the Saint-Jean-Baptiste District, this grand 5-bedroom apartment also offers a huge kitchen for gathering.

Located just steps from the beginnings, attractions, old Quebec, highways and urban life, this apartment certainly has something to make your stay in Quebec memorable.

Rental + 90 days (full month)
neighborhood_overview:
"The Saint-Jean-Baptiste district awaits you!
Come and discover a neighborhood in the heart of Quebec City. Meet warm, authentic, endearing, and passionate people. Discover the richness of its history, architecture, and attractions and be seduced by its artisans.

Fins palaces and gourmands, you have a meeting with the flavors of the Saint-Jean-Baptiste district! Give birth to an afternoon craving in the artisanal shops and delicatessens that are famous for the Faubourg. Share a moment with friends at its friendly bars where locals gather in a friendly way. Discover the many multiethnic restaurants that open their doors.

Come entertain, dance, and watch all kinds of shows in the local bars, pubs, bistros, and cabarets. Under the flakes and hot season, treat yourself to the original boutiques that the neighborhood has to offer: handmade items, import products, and a variety of creations. Visit unique clothing, shoe, and accessory shops in Quebec City.
host_about:
On a grandi dans des  familles ou recevoir était naturel. Quand il y en a pour 5, il y en a pour 6, répétait ma mère. La porte ouverte et le cœur accueillant. 
 
Chez nous, le chalet était un lieu sacré, un 600 pi2 qui pouvait recevoir autant de personne que notre cœur était prêt à en recevoir. 
 
Recevoir simplement. Accueillir chaleureusement. Partager et s’unir pour mieux grandir. 
 
Et puis, en grandissant, recevoir n’était plus simplement naturel, c’était nécessaire.
Alors du haut de nos valeurs les plus sincères, on en a fait un métier: 
 
Rendre des lieux d’évasion entre ville et montagne accessibles et accueillants pour rassembler et partager. 
 
Aujourd’hui notre grande famille compte 40 établissements dans lesquels se multiplient les souvenirs.

Bask in the European charm of this UNESCO World Heritage treasure as you stroll and take in over 400 years of history in the birthplace of French North America.

name: ♥️Le Cocon Moderne♥Garage-2 chambres-tranquille-AC
description:
New modern condo in new secure building located close to all attractions, restaurants, shops and nightlife. This condo is a bright corner unit located on the 4th floor. Roof top terrace is stunning to enjoy a drink or to cook on BBQ after a day walking around. Enjoy the free underground parking. The private balcony is ideal for morning coffee. Many restaurants and bars at walking distance
Chateau Frontenac and Old Quebec it's a 30 minutes walk
All this and more can be yours for your next trip
neighborhood_overview:
When searching for a condo as an investment, we were looking for the perfect spot with a minimum of maintenance to do. Something close to the city with a specific local vibe. So when we heard about the Kameleon project, we knew right away that this would be the perfect place to welcome guests from all over the world! Close enough to the Old City but in a district that have all the best restaurants to discover. Foodies you will not be disappointed! You can also take a culinary tour that occurs in the same street as the Modern Cocoon. You can easily walk to rue St-Joseph and discover all this vibrant street has to offer. We as locals, often go to theese very close by restaurants: Kraken cru ( seafood) Batutto (voted top 10 best new Canadian restaurant) l’Affaire est Ketshup, la Champagnerie ( large champagne selection)
and also le Clocher Penché ( French Bistrot ) And if you want to enjoy a delicious poutine Le Coin de la Patate is just beside!
host_about: J’adore voyager! En tant qu’invité ce que j’aime est de m’imprégner de la culture locale de l’endroit. Donc en tant qu’hôte nous souhaitons faire vivre la même expérience à nos invités. C’est pourquoi nos propriétés sont choisies méticuleusement selon la localisation, la qualité de l’hébergement et l’expérience globale.
